intro: Ageratina jalpana, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue or purple and arranged in clusters. Ageratina jalpana is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
